summary: Brené Brown, Ph.D., LMSW, is a distinguished research professor at the University of Houston Graduate College of Social Work. She has gained recognition for her engaging and insightful talks on vulnerability, courage, and shame, leaving an impact on audiences worldwide. Her TEDxHouston talk, 'The Power of Vulnerability,' remains one of the most popular TED talks to date. In addition to her speaking engagements, she has authored several influential books that focus on shame resilience. Brené balances her professional life with family time in Houston, sharing her experiences and insights with her husband and two children.

slides.section_body: Brené Brown is a research professor at the University of Houston's Graduate College of Social Work. Her academic background underpins her extensive research on vulnerability and shame. Brené's work not only contributes to the field of social work but also resonates with a global audience.
slides.quote: Vulnerability is the birthplace of innovation, creativity, and change.

slides.section_body: Brené is celebrated as a nationally renowned speaker, captivating audiences with her engaging presentations. She has received numerous teaching awards, showcasing her talent in conveying complex ideas in an accessible manner. Her insights on emotional courage have transformed lives.
slides.quote: Courage starts with showing up and letting ourselves be seen.

slides.section_body: Her TEDxHouston talk, 'The Power of Vulnerability,' is one of the most viewed TED talks, with over 5 million views. This talk has sparked conversations around vulnerability and courage. Brené’s ability to connect with audiences sets her apart in the world of public speaking.
slides.quote: What we know matters, but who we are matters more.

slides.section_title: A Voice on Shame and Courage
slides.section_body: Brené delivered the closing talk at the 2012 TED conference, emphasizing the importance of understanding shame in our lives. Her insights encourage people to embrace their humanity and explore their emotional experiences positively. She advocates for courage in the face of adversity.
slides.quote: Shame corrodes the very part of us that believes we are capable of change.

slides.section_body: Brené is the author of several impactful books, including 'The Gifts of Imperfection' and 'I Thought It Was Just Me.' Her writings explore themes of shame resilience and human connection. Each book provides readers with tools to foster a healthier relationship with themselves.
slides.quote: Imperfections are not inadequacies; they are reminders that we’re all in this together.

slides.section_body: In 'The Gifts of Imperfection,' Brené encourages readers to embrace their imperfections. She believes that authenticity and self-worth are vital in overcoming societal pressures. Through her research, she illustrates how imperfection is a pathway to courage.
slides.quote: Authenticity is a collection of choices that we have to make every day.

slides.section_body: Brené’s 'Connections' curriculum is designed to help individuals and professionals build shame resilience. It is implemented globally by helping professionals aiming to foster emotional health. Brené’s commitment to transformation is evident in her work.
slides.quote: We cannot selectively numb our emotions.

slides.section_body: Brené balances her impactful career with family life, living in Houston with her husband and two children. She often discusses the importance of family and relationships in her works. Her grounded nature reflects in both her professional and personal life.
slides.quote: Connection is why we’re here; it is what gives purpose and meaning to our lives.

slides.section_body: Brené embodies the essence of lifelong learning, constantly evolving her research and insights. She encourages others to embrace their journeys of growth and self-discovery. Her resilience in the academic field reflects her passion for understanding human emotions.
slides.quote: The willingness to show up changes us. It makes us a little braver each time.

slides.section_body: Through her teachings, Brené inspires individuals to live authentically and courageously. Her influence reaches far beyond academia, touching hearts and minds around the world. Brené's work serves as a powerful reminder of the strength found in vulnerability.
slides.quote: Vulnerability is not weakness; it’s our greatest measure of courage.
